p: Neutrophils are crucial for the innate immunity. G-CSF is therefore used in neutropenic patients as a preventive treatment to avoid infections. Still, a study with transplant recipients reported that preventive G-CSF treatment did not alter infection-related mortality in these patients ( 51). While this supports the relevance of reduced neutrophil functionality, i.e., the ability to reach the site of infection in vivo by chemotaxis, others described an unchanged infection risk in G-CSF-treated HSC donors ( 52). Taken together, this suggests a potential compensation by number if neutrophil functionality is reduced.
